ch.iserver.ace.util
Interface ThreadDomain

All Known Implementing Classes:
BoundedThreadDomain, CallerThreadDomain, IsolatedThreadDomain, SingleThreadDomain
public interface ThreadDomain

ThreadDomain allow to wrap objects so that they are executed on different threads. By using thread domains, it is possible to easily determine the number of threads in a system. A thread domain could create a worker thread for each call to wrap(Object, Class) or could use a more conservative approach. It is even possible to choose an implementation that returns the target object unmodified, thus executing the methods in the thread of the caller.

Method Detail

setName

void setName(String name)
Sets the name of this ThreadDomain. Names are mainly useful in debug mode.

Parameters:
name - the name of the thread domain

getName

String getName()
Gets the name of this ThreadDomain. The name is mainly useful for debugging and logging output.

Returns:
the name of the domain

wrap

Object wrap(Object target,
            Class clazz)
Wraps the target object so that calls to it are executed in this ThreadDomain.

Parameters:
target - the target object to be wrapped
clazz - the interface implemented by the target object
Returns:
the proxied target object

wrap

Object wrap(Object target,
            Class clazz,
            boolean ignoreNonVoidMethods)
Wraps the target object so that calls to it are executed in this ThreadDomain. The ignoreNonVoidMethods parameter determines whether the async interceptor is applied to methods having a void return type.

Parameters:
target - the target object
clazz - the interface implemented by the target object
ignoreNonVoidMethods - do not invoke non-void return typed methods asynchronously
Returns:
the wrapped object

dispose

void dispose()
Disposes this thread domain.
